info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 6:49AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A THUNDERSTORM WITH INTENSE LIGHTNING AND TORRENTIAL RAINFALL WILL IMPACT EASTERN FRANKLIN...HART...WEST CENTRAL ANDERSON AND SOUTHEASTERN OCONEE COUNTIES UNTIL 730 AM EDT... At 648 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with intense lightning and torrential rainfall 4 miles east of Carnesville, or near Canon, moving northeast at 25 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Seneca, Hartwell, Carnesville, Royston, Reed Creek, Lavonia, Gumlog, Canon, Franklin Springs and Bowersville. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 1 to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas. Deep ponding of water may develop on area roadways in poor drainage locations.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters. Frequent lightning is occurring with this storm. If outdoors, try to get indoors or into a hard topped vehicle. Otherwise, stay away from open areas and isolated high objects such as trees. When indoors, stay away from windows and doors and avoid using wired electronic devices.
